channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ghana arrests Nigerians accused of running cyber-crime networks
item.description: There is a growing trend of foreigners being lured to Ghana under the pretext of lucrative work.

item.title: South African team helps search for politician swept away by Mozambique floodwaters
item.description: Mozambique President Daniel Chapo cancels a trip to Davos due to severe floods in the country

item.title: What to know about the annual World Economic Forum meeting in Davos
item.description: Nearly 3,000 high-level participants from business, government and beyond are converging on the Swiss town of Davos for the annual meeting.

item.title: What we know about Spain's worst rail disaster in over a decade
item.description: What caused the train to derail remains unclear but officials say an investigation has been launched.

item.title: Trump ties Greenland demands to Nobel Prize in message to Norway leader
item.description: The US president says he no longer feels obliged to think only of peace, after not being awarded the annual prize.

item.title: "The Dish: Recipe": Classic Umbrian lentil soup
item.description: In this edition of "The Dish: Recipe," co-author of Milk Street Backroads Italy, J.M. Hirsch, shares a classic Umbrian recipe for lentil soup.

item.title: Russia gives U.S. man 5-year prison term, accusing him of transporting weapons

item.title: Swiss deadly fire bar owners' lawyers condemn 'vindictiveness'
item.description: Lawyers for the Moretti couple say "lies" have been circulating about their clients, in their first public statement since the fire.

item.title: Somali businesses struggle during the Minneapolis ICE crackdown
Army puts 1,500 soldiers on standby for possible Minnesota deployment, AP sources say
Sending soldiers to Minneapolis for immigration crackdown would be unconstitutional, mayor says
item.description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey says sending active duty soldiers to Minnesota for an immigration crackdown is ridiculous and unconstitutional.
